	charset=US-ASCII;
	delsp=yes;
	format=flowed

Hi StAck,

>>
> Are you talking of nutch, Stefan?

NO! :-)
As you know I'm reading and posting in the nutch mailing list as well  
and I had done some contributions, however there was a time where I  
wasn't happy with some decisions.
So I decide 'just for fun' :-) writing some own 'standalone' tools,  
that can reused for different projects, since nutch components are to  
much coupled -  from my point of view.

Actually there is:

+ a distributed file system, version 0.3..0 running but hasn't a meta  
data controller fail-over. (it will be the next task)
+ it comes with a url stream handler so you can do  things like:
new BufferedOutputStream(new URL("wetadfs://aFolder/ 
aFile").openConnection().getOutputStream()).write(myBytes);

http://weta-group.net/weta-dfs/


+ a map reduce implementation, that will hopefully release a first  
release candidate until next 2 or 3 weeks.
http://weta-group.net/weta-mr/


+ a component container using peer 2 peer  communication (jxta), mx4j  
based Inversion of control, has remote deployment and providing a  
remote object proxy component.
remote proxies makes communication between the workers transparent to  
the developer, that save a lot of time and you can focus on 'logic'  
instead managing infrastructure.
it works like:

ProxyFactory factory = new ProxyFactory(new RemoteInvocationController 
("communicationProtocoll://hostMachine"));

Class[] signatureOfConstructor = null;
Object[] constructorArguments = null;
TestHelloWorld remoteProxy = (TestHelloWorld) factory.createProxy 
(TestHelloWorld.class, signatureOfConstructor, constructorArguments);
assertEquals("hello", remoteProxy.hello());

webpage:
http://weta-group.net/weta-g/
some documentation:
http://weta-group.net/confluence/display/wetaGDoc/Home

We have a maven based build, using cruse control for CI and doing  
test first development.
There are 3 full time developers 2 half-time working on the projects  
(since we use the tools for a government project) furthermore 3  
Students writing diploma about related themes like 'Text Clustering  
with map reduce'.
However you can NOT YET await to much from the code, but as mentioned  
we have some serious deadlines.

Greetings.
Stefan 
--Apple-Mail-5-1011087943
